meanings.definition: In a stable manner; firmly or securely.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was placed stably against the wall.
meanings.sent2: She held onto the railing stably as she descended the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel balanced stably on the thin branch, looking quite confident.
meanings.sent4: His beliefs were stably rooted in his upbringing, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The old house stood stably through many storms, a testament to its solid construction.

meanings.definition: In a steady or unchanging manner.
meanings.sent1: The clock ticked stably, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent2: Her heartbeat remained stably calm during the meditation.
meanings.sent3: The river flowed stably, never rushing or slowing down.
meanings.sent4: His grades in school stayed stably average, never improving or declining.
meanings.sent5: The flame burned stably, unaffected by the gentle breeze around it.
